text:
They are known for showing off their figures in skimpy and sexy outfits both on and off stage.
And Little Mix certainly did not disappoint in the style stakes on Wednesday night, as they took to the BRIT Awards stage in matching ensembles and striking blonde wigs.
Perrie Edwards, Jesy Nelson, Leigh-Anne Pinnock and Jade Thirlwall got this year's awards to a pitch perfect start as they belted out their hit Shout Out To My Ex at London 's O2 Arena in typically raunchy metallic leotards.
Fierce: Little Mix certainly did not disappoint in the style stakes on Wednesday night, as they took to the BRIT Awards stage in matching ensembles and striking blonde wigs
The girls made a dramatic entrance to kick off the show, as they were carried to the stage atop thrones befitting of their status as pop royalty.
Strutting their stuff on stage as the track began, the stunners proceeded to deliver an effortlessly professional performance - although much of the focus was on their barely-there looks.
The four-piece writhed around the stage in their shimmering one-pieces, which rose to daring heights at their thighs to flash their long and slender figures to all.
Sexy: Strutting their stuff on stage as the track began, the stunners proceeded to deliver an effortlessly professional performance - although he focus was on their barely-there looks
Each look was slightly different to maintain their individual styles - with Jade and Leigh-Anne sporting crop tops and hot pants to give an extra flash of their abs to the audience.
Uniting them as a band however, all four girls teamed their shimmering ensembles with racy thigh-high boots, which laced at the front, and matching hairstyles.
While Perrie is typically blonde, the other three girls sported bold wigs for the bash to pack an extra punch during the set - with Leigh-Anne going retro with a wild afro, while Jesy rocked sexy tousled waves.
Saucy: The four-piece (Perrie pictured) writhed around the stage in their shimmering one-pieces, which rose to daring heights at their thighs to flash their long and slender figures to all
Stunning: Jesy's version cinched in at her petite waist and plunged low to flash her cleavage
Attitude: The girls were the epitome of fierce as they stormed the stage to open the prestigious awards
Sexy: Uniting them as a band however, all four girls teamed their shimmering ensembles with racy thigh-high boots, which laced at the front
Backed by a plethora of silver painted dancers, the girls performed their moves with plenty of attitude, no doubt getting everyone in the O2 even more excited than they already were.
The energetic set was met with rave reviews from fans, who took to Twitter in their hundreds to praise the band.
One wrote excitedly: 'Little Mix absolutely stormed it with their show-stopping performance', while another added in agreement: 'No one in the industry comes close to the talent they have!'
Blondes have more fun: While Perrie is typically blonde, the other three girls sported bold wigs for the bash to pack an extra punch during the set
Toned: Each look was slightly different to maintain their individual styles - with Jade and Leigh-Anne (above) sporting crop tops and hot pants to give an extra flash of their abs
All eyes on us: The girls wowed crowds with a live performance of their dance track - no doubt getting everyone in the O2 even more excited than they already were
Loving it: The energetic set was met with rave reviews from fans, who took to Twitter in their hundreds to praise the band
Further fans added that the girls 'slayed' the performance while another addressed their striking new looks by writing: 'Loving them all as blondies!'
Only adding to the success of the night, the four piece then went on to win their first ever BRIT award in the Best British Single category.
The award was no doubt made more satisfying for Perrie however, who beat her ex-boyfriend Zayn Malik in the category.
Sexy ladies: Backed by a plethora of silver painted dancers, the girls performed their moves with plenty of attitude
We won! Only adding to the success of the night, the four piece then went on to win their first ever BRIT award in the Best British Single category
Despite paying tribute to their ex partners in their acceptance speech, Zayn wasn't in attendance, choosing to skip the event despite his nomination.
The girls were not fazed, with Jade gushing on stage: 'Thank you so much. We honestly didn't think we were gonna get it, we were just sat there chinwagging.
'We'd like to thank our label Sony, Syco, Simon (Cowell), our amazing A&R, our management, and us girls, because if it wasn't for our friendship, we wouldn't still be going. And lastly cheers to our exes for helping us to do an amazing song, this one's for you lads.'
The girls are the first girl group to win a BRIT Award in eight years - with Girls Aloud being the last to nab a gong back in 2009.
